data.title: Elections – Page 209 – POLITICO
data.meta_description: Latest politics and policy news on Elections
data.text:
Orbán to run for reelection as prime minister

Recent opinion polls put support for Hungary’s conservative Fidesz party at 51 percent.

Sarkozy’s Les Républicains make the biggest gains while Le Pen disappoints.

Voter turnout high in French regional elections

The surge suggests mainstream voters could be looking to blunt the rise of the far-right Front National.

Everything you need to know about the elections in France

Marine Le Pen tries to hold onto her dominant position in Sunday’s second round of voting.

Spanish poll sees Socialists trailing fourth, Rajoy ahead

Conservative PM Rajoy places first in the poll, just over a week ahead of the vote.

9 things Europeans must know about Donald Trump

He’s not really going to be president, is he?

The PM’s conservatives are in the lead but no party is seen winning more than 30 percent.

Little Lisbon loses patience with Portugal’s left

Small town in rural England illustrates problems facing Portugal’s new Socialist premier.

Latvian prime minister quits over coalition intrigues

Possible successors could be the interior minister or the Unity Party chief.

The ‘old guard’ has got Mariano Rajoy’s back

Older voters from the sparsely-populated hinterland could be decisive in Spain’s closest elections.

Spanish poll points to three-way election heat

Prime Minister Mariano Rajoy is way beyond in personal approval ratings.

Mariano Rajoy hopes for a rally-round-the-flag effect

POLITICO’s In the loop podcast gives you a roundup of the week that has been and those events that will spark the debate in the weeks to come.
